SENT.plain: Behcet's disease is a vasculitis affecting predominantly the venous system
It's characterized by a classical triad of recurrent uveitis, oral and genital ulceration
Behcet's disease is more frequent in Japan, the Middle East and some Mediterranean countries
Neurological manifestations in Behcet's disease are not rare and are associated with poor prognosis
These manifestations can be inaugural in 5% of cases and they are polymorphous
We report 15 new cases of neuro Behcet's disease explored by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and magnetic resonance angiography (MRA)
